13.heading: Tuska, George, 1916-
13.title: "The Black Lama!"
13.author: Mike Friedrich, writer & George Tuska, artist ; additional pencils by Jim Starlin ; inks by Vince Colletta ; lettering by Artie Simek
notes: SUMMARY: Iron Man struggles with Raga, Son of Fire, whose master The Black Lama describes training Raga to be part of his "world-wide web" of pupils, then deserts him as a failed pupil, so that although the Black Lama is on a separate mystic plane and Iron Man cannot touch him, Iron Man is victorious. 113.heading: Tutankamen.
113.title: The Tomb : a Jessica Parrish Adventure
113.author: written by Nunzio DeFilippis & Christina Weir ; illustrated by Christopher Mitten.
notes: "In 1922, Lord Earl Carnarvon financed the Egyptian expedition that unearthed King Tut's tomb. While the fact that the dig gained a reputation for being 'cursed' is well known, Mathias Fowler slipped away into anonymity. Fowler, an American on the team, had grown obsessed with the Ancient Egyptians and when he returned to the States it was with several stolen artifacts in tow. Now, almost 60 years after Fowler's death, Jessica Parrish, archeologist and would-be Indiana Jones, has been hired to assemble and lead a team into Fowler's abandoned estate to take back the missing pieces."

155.heading: Tutors.
155.title: "Jawaharlal Nehru : the Early Days"
155.author: script, Margie Sastry ; illustrations, Yusuf Bangalorewala ; editor, Anant Pai
155.appears_in: p. 1-29 in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 700 (1991, 2010 printing).
notes: (Visionaries)

Summary from back cover: "From his father he learned social etiquette; from his mother, India's age-old philosophy and culture. From his Muslim mentor he learned to respect different faiths, and from his English tutor the best of Western and Indian thought. But none of them could have moulded the young Jawaharlal Nehru into the fiercely idealistic Indian so famous throughout the world today. That distinction he achieved by his own intelligence, keen observation and hard work."

Villains are Super-Brain, Black Axemen (introduced), Scarface (introduced); also introduced are Ranger Girl (Gloria Travis), Phineas B. Tutts.
Data from Lou Mougin via The Grand Comics Database Project.

233.title: Tuxedo Gin
233.author: story and art by Tokihiko Matsuura ; translator, Kenichiro Yagi.
notes: "Meet seventeen-year-old Ginji Kusanagi. Things are going great for him; he's only in high school but he's on the eve of making his debut as a pro-boxer. He's also just met Minako Sasebo, the girl of his dreams. Unfortunately, Ginji has an accident and dies...and is then reincarnated into a penguin! Will love be able to bloom between a boxing penguin and a beautiful girl?"
